alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 31 at 3:07AM PDT until July 31 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Riverside County in southern California... Eastern San Diego County in southwestern California... * Until 500 AM PDT. * At 303 AM PDT, Thunderstorm outflow is creating a large area of blowing dust moving from Imperial County into the deserts of San Diego County, and the Coachella Valley. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility at times, with east to southeast wind gusts of 40 to 50 MPH. SOURCE...Surface observations. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Areas of blowing dust can reduce visibility at times, making driving difficult. Locations impacted include... Indio, northern Palm Springs, Coachella, Borrego Springs, I-8 Between Boulevard And Imperial County Line, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Hwy 78 Between Borrego Springs Rd And Ocotillo Wells, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Mt San Jacinto State Park, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, Cathedral City, Palm Desert, Desert Hot Springs, Rancho Mirage, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Hwy S22 Between Borrego Springs And Imperial County Line, Hwy S2 Vallecito Creek Rd, Ocotillo Wells, and Hwy S2 Between Canebrake And Imperial County Line. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
